item.title: Rose add a quote by Anthony Brandt
item.description: "Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family." -- Anthony Brandt

item.title: Rose add a quote by Ben Williams
item.description: "There is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face." -- Ben Williams

item.title: Rose add a quote by Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis
item.description: "I have been through a lot and have suffered a great deal. But I have had lots of happy moments, as well. Every moment one lives is different from the other. The good, the bad, hardship, the joy, the tragedy, love, and happiness are all interwoven into one single, indescribable whole that is called life. You cannot separate the good from the bad. And perhaps there is no need to do so, either." -- Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

item.title: Rose add a quote by Pamela Redmond Satran
item.description: "Every woman should have a youth she's content to leave behind and a past juicy enough that she's looking forward to telling it in her old age" -- Pamela Redmond Satran

item.title: Rose add a quote by Joan Rivers
item.description: "A man can sleep around, no questions asked, but if a woman makes nineteen or twenty mistakes she's a tramp." -- Joan Rivers

item.title: Rose add a quote by Barbara Bush
item.description: "Clinton lied. A man might forget where he parks or where he lives, but he never forgets oral sex, no matter how bad it is." -- Barbara Bush

item.title: Rose add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann

item.title: Rose add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "Health food makes me sick." -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Rose add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Rose add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "I am not sure exactly what heaven will be like, but I know that when we die and it comes time for God to judge us, he will not ask, 'How many good things have you done in your life?' rather he will ask, 'How much love did you put into what you did?" -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Rose add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rose add a quote by Larry Wilde
item.description: "Never worry about the size of your Christmas tree. In the eyes of children, they are all thirty feet tall." -- Larry Wilde

item.title: Rose add a quote by Elizabeth Berg
item.description: "You are always in my thoughts. When you were little, I knew your whereabouts at any given moment. Now that you are...off on your own, I still always know where you are, because I keep you in my heart." -- Elizabeth Berg
